thread.title: West Linn police search for motorcyclist who slashed woman's tire in road rage incident
thread.title_full: West Linn police search for motorcyclist who slashed woman's tire in road rage incident | OregonLive.com

author: Nuran Alteir | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: West Linn police search for motorcyclist who slashed woman's tire in road rage incident
text:
Police are looking for a man who slashed a woman's tire in an apparent road rage incident Thursday on Interstate 205 near West Linn.
At about 5:30 p.m., West Linn police responded to a report of a motorcyclist who became threatening after an argument with a woman driver who was northbound on I-205 near 10th Street.
"The motorcyclist got off his bike, pounded on the woman's window, unsuccessfully attempting to open the door," and then removed a long, skinny, silver and sharp object from his boot and used it to stab the victim's tire, West Linn Police wrote in a news release. He then rode away quickly.
The man was said to be about 5-foot-7, with salt-and-pepper hair and a short beard. He was wearing a dark helmet, a black leather jacket with orange-colored writing, blue jeans and black leather chaps. He was riding a dark motorcycle with high handlebars.
Witnesses are asked to call 503-635-0238.
